formalMetadata.description: A document with text in English that contains nautical terms. Below the text is a glossary with the nautical terms that are used in the text; there are links between the nautical terms in the text and the corresponding glossary entries. Browser that support the CSS pseudo-selector :onfocus will highlight the glossary entry when a user activates the link to the term. (This works in Mozilla and Firefox but not in Internet Explorer 6 or Opera 7.54.) [Some links, for phrases that don't have or don't need a glossary entry, lead to a dummy page.]
formalMetadata.title: English text with glossary of nautical terms - nautical terms link to glossary entries
formalMetadata.dc:creator: Christophe.Strobbe@esat.kuleuven.be

purpose.p: This test case is intended to pass because a definition list near the bottom of the page helps the user to find definitions of words. Only the availability of definitions is tested here, not any other links or features in the test file.

userGuidance.p: In this test a specialized text with nautical terms is presented to you. Please read the first paragraph and find in the dictionary the definitions of the words “cruisers” and “destroyers” one after another. Then read the second paragraph and find the definition of the word “turrests”.

questionText.p: Was the mechanism of presenting the word definitions adequate ?
